One student told me that he went to bed around three and woke up each morning at seven; he could afford that much rest because he had learned to supplement his full day of work by studying in his sleep. As he was falling asleep he would narrate a math question or a presentation topic to himself; he would then sometimes dream about it, and after he woke up, the question might have been solved. I would go back to my hotel at around 11 p.m each night, and after waking up, I would see my mailbox full of replies. Last year, I went to Columbia University to observe the youth who is going to run our country in a few decades. Faculty members gave me the names of couple of students, and I sent them e-mails, inviting them out to lunch or dinner in small groups.

The length of one-degree arc would be less near the equatorial latitudes than at the poles. However, the question of ‘how much more’ was yet to be established. One way of doing it is to determine the length of the arc along a chosen longitude or meridian at one-degree latitude separation. It was generally known that the earth was not a sphere but an ‘oblate spheroid’, more curved at the equator and flat at the poles. This fact was then established in the 1730s by French survey expeditions. In the late 18th century, one of the unsettled scientific questions was the exact nature of the shape of the Earth.

Shining like a true gem in the Indonesian archipelago is the mesmerizing island of Bali. To the local Balinese people, this beautiful island is the center of the spiritual universe. With over 84% of Hindu population, Bali is famous for its culture, medicine and beautiful beaches. However, the true visitor delights are its cuisine and multi-specialty spas. The traditional Balinese massage centers around the holistic treatment involving techniques like reflexology, acupressure and aromatherapy. In addition, one can enjoy many skin and hair care services offered in almost all spas and resorts at very reasonable prices. Bali is more than just a beach destination. In the northern region of the island, quaint towns like Ubud and Singaraja offer a cool haven in the foothills. Further north is the beautiful Kintamani village which is a doorway to one of Bali's most popular destinations, Mount Batur. This active volcano is perfect for hikers who look forward to the mystic sunrise after an exhausting yet worthwhile all night trek. Bali has something or the other in store for everyone. There are many reasons why it is considered more than just a honeymoon destination. Whether you are a solo traveler or a part of a travel group, Bali has an array of attractions that draw millions of visitors every year to its long stretch of beaches, lush green mountains and beautiful rivers. Which techniques are involved in a traditional Balinese massage?
Circular pressure Reflexology & acupressure Kneading Aromatherapy
1|3
ed6fdd75464944589d2526a22d00e133 e46cd0282a75410a87f70800fb101ffd MULTI_CHOICE_MULTIPLE_ANSWER READING Read the text and answer the question by selecting all the correct responses. You will need to select more than one response. 00:02:00
Secret is not a privilege, it’s a punishment, a constant source of fear and paranoia. Life was taking another turn for me. I had no other option but to play along, do what it asked me to do and so I decided to move ahead instead of staying back, helpless and dejected. The people I was leaving behind will never understand why I chose to stop being a part of their lives; where I came from, where I went and why did I come so close if I had to drift apart. I just left them with a myriad of questions that will perhaps never be answered in their lives. Maintaining a permanent distance was not a choice but a compulsion for me. Very soon it will be another town, another set of lies, more people will come in, only to be pushed away and I will have to leave before anyone gets to know. So that's my destiny. It was a surprisingly bright day as opposed to the otherwise usual damp weather the city of Cardiff is famous for. I woke up early as I didn't want to miss the 8:15 bus to the new office. It’s an interesting thing, online interview; you can practically apply from anywhere and get selected, get an offer, give your consent to it and head towards your future, just with a click of the mouse. I was supposed to meet Chelsea, my workplace mentor for the first day in office. I was understandably worried and nervous about going to a new office, meeting new people. My concern was not about them being nice to me, but over-friendly and affectionate. It seems like that's what puts me through trouble most of the times. What was the protagonist’s primary fear about being in new office?
facing hostility experiencing over-friendly behavior from others meeting her mentor over-friendly and affectionate approach from colleagues
1|3
3d85b22792ef41f4bb2035f513fabe0b e46cd0282a75410a87f70800fb101ffd MULTI_CHOICE_SINGLE_ANSWER READING Read the text and answer the multiple-choice question by selecting the correct response. Only one response is correct. 00:00:59
The 2015 edition of The Championships at Wimbledon witnessed the continued dominance of two of the sport’s biggest stars, Novak Djokovic and Serena Williams. Both Williams and Djokovic are ranked No.1 in the world and are enjoying one of the best seasons of their careers. For Serena in particular, the 2015 season turned out to be extremely fruitful with only one loss coming at the hands of defending Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova. With a win at Wimbledon, Serena completed an elusive second Serena Slam, holding all four grand slam titles at the same time. For Novak Djokovic, it was a sweet return to the winner’s circle, having lost the French Open final to Swiss Stanislas Wawrinka a month ago. In women’s doubles, India’s Sania Mirza paired with former World No.1 Martina Hingis to win an epic final against the Russian pair of Ekaterina Makarova and Elena Vesnina. The mixed doubles final saw another Indian star Leander Paes re-establish his supremacy when he claimed the title with Martina Hingis, for whom the second title at the All England lawn tennis Club was a remarkable addition to an already successful fortnight. Why is the 2015 season so special for Serena Williams?
Because she claimed her first Serena Slam Because she reclaimed the No.1 spot in WTA rankings Because she has suffered only one loss so far and holds all four majors at the moment Because she won every tournament she entered in 2015
2

The sudden and tragic demise of Gianni Versace left the fashion fraternity shocked. On the unfortunate morning of 15th July 1997, while returning from his morning walk at his Miami residence, Versace was killed by Andrew Cunanan, a serial killer. Eight days after killing Versace, Cunanan shot himself to death. Friends to celebrities and royalty alike, Versace’s burial and service was attended by numerous such personalities including Late Princess Diana and Sir Elton John. Almost 50% of Gianni Versace’s wealth was inherited by his niece Allegra Versace, whereas Donatella Versace, Allegra’s mother became the head of design. Versace joined the fashion industry at the age of 26 in 1972 and soon after, was recognized for his work by big players like Complice, who signed a contract with Versace to design their lace and leather creations. Versace followed in his success well and had his first men’s fashion show presented after which he opened his first boutique in Milan. Versace is also known to have lent his work to some of Hollywood’s most successful ventures like Showgirls (1995), Hard to Kill (1990) and Once upon a crime (1992). Who was the sole inheritor (heir) to Gianni Versace’s wealth at the time of his demise?
Allegra Versace Donatella Versace Andrew Cunanan None of the above
3
f25b6424ad414f33a9ea69117129b868 e46cd0282a75410a87f70800fb101ffd MULTI_CHOICE_SINGLE_ANSWER READING Read the text and answer the multiple-choice question by selecting the correct response. Only one response is correct. 00:00:59
When we look back, it seems that US attitude toward nuclear war was absolutely silly. Kids hiding under desks, bomb shelters beneath homes, and massive retaliation are some of the memories from those turbulent times. However, it seems that we were probably right to be anxious about the Soviets and their will to use the bomb. In the 60’s, Soviet leader Kruschev offered to move missiles to Cuba. The possibility of Nuclear war was, in fact, on the cards and, no matter how frivolous it may seem now, it was better to be prepared than to be destroyed. With which of the following statements would the author most likely agree?
Nuclear war is a larger problem now than it was in the 60’s Kruschev would never actually use a nuclear weapon The US was prepared for all-out nuclear war in the 60’s The US took the threat of nuclear war seriously in the 60’s Cuba would not have launched a nuclear attack
3
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Both Williams and Djokovic are ranked No.1 in the world and are enjoying one of the best seasons of their careers. For Serena in particular, the 2015 season turned out to be extremely fruitful with only one loss coming at the hands of defending Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova. To the world, Abraham Lincoln is known as one of the most popular and revered presidents of The United States of America. However, to me, he will always remain an epitome of persistence and integrity. Best remembered for being responsible for the abolition of slavery, Lincoln faced a series of failures before becoming the 16th president of The United States of America in 1861. His political struggle started in 1838 when he sought to be the speaker of the state legislature but lost. A couple of years later, Lincoln decided to become an elector but tasted defeat once again. He ran for congress several times in the subsequent years but failed miserably. In 1854, Lincoln ran for the senate of the United States but once again, failed to clear the election process. After another unsuccessful attempt for nomination of Vice-presidential candidature at his party’s national convention, Lincoln ran for senate in 1858, and despite losing, was finally elected as the President of the USA two years later. His story is a lesson to those who give up prolonged personal battles by simply crediting luck and fate for success in life. Abraham Lincoln is mostly remembered for__________
epitome of persistence abolition of slavery 16th president of the USA repeated failures
1

There is a saying, "Beauty lies in the eye of the beholder". It is probably true as beauty is a concept with a fleeting definition. However, beauty differs from culture to culture For example: some African cultures find women with large noses very attractive, while in the West people favour the quintessential blond. Those who try to impose beauty typically come up short - ask Hitler how his Aryan race is doing these days. The fact is that beauty is something to be appreciated and not understood. Which of the following examples corresponds to the "blond" ?
introspective beauty conflicting perceptions archetypal perceptions introverted personality

Bats are the only mammals that can fly. The bat’s wing resembles the human hand anatomically. It has elongated fingers and a wing membrane stretched in between. Bats make approximately one fourth of all mammal species on earth as there are around 1000 bat species that can be found all across the world. Bats mostly consume insects and therefore share a large part of natural pest control. Apart from insect consuming bats, there are also fruit-eating bats, nectar-eating bats, fish-eating bats, carnivorous bats that prey on small mammals and perhaps the blood-sucking vampire bats of South America. While some bats are high in number, others are dangerously low and are declining day by day. Bats are found almost everywhere in the world except the Polar regions and extreme deserts. These bats have a high level of sense of hearing. They emit sounds that bounce off of objects in their path, sending echoes back to the bats. From these echoes, the bats can determine how far the object is, its size, how fast is it travelling and even its texture, all in just few seconds. In order to survive the winter, some species of bat migrate; some hibernate whereas some go into torpor that can last from few hours to a few months. The gestation duration for bats is 40 days to 6 months on an average and they mostly litter one pup. What all aspects have been mentioned in the passage by the author?
Reproduction Overwintering Behaviour Diet and Population Size Lifespan

Since then, intelligence tests have been mostly used to separate dull children in school from average or bright children, so that special education can be provided to the dull ones. Intelligence is measured as intelligence quotient, and these tests are developed to indicate what an average child of a certain age can do: For instance, what a preschooler can answer, but a toddler cannot. Intelligence can be measured by various tests. Hence, intelligence tests are very useful for each age group. Binet was the first one to develop the first set of such tests in order to find children who needed special attention in school.

For centuries, the Incan citadel of Machu Picchu has been the center of curiosity around the world. Built in the 15th century in current day Peru, Machu Picchu is not only a UNESCO world heritage site but also one of the seven wonders of the modern world. Located at the height of 2430 meters above sea level, the ruins of Machu Picchu are one of the most visited tourist attractions in South America. It is believed that the city of Machu Picchu was abandoned by its residents after a smallpox outbreak and remained lost for over three centuries before Hiram Bingham rediscovered it in 1911. During the Millennium project that started in 2000 to choose the seven wonders of the modern world, the Peruvian ministry of tourism made tremendous efforts to encourage the media and citizens to vote for Machu Picchu which eventually resulted in its selection over architectural wonders like Eiffel Tower and Statue of Liberty. In a measure to lessen the severity of tourist impact on the citadel, the Peruvian government implemented tougher entrance rules from July 2011, allowing only 2500 visitors per day. Despite the restrictions, Machu Picchu continues to attract hordes of people every year and remains one of the most photographed sites in the world. Machu Picchu is considered as :
one of the most photographed sites in the world The most popular of the seven wonders of the world one of the most visited place in South America one of the most visited places in the world.

Pate island is the largest island in the Lamu Archipelago. This island is located in the Indian Ocean close to the northern coast of Kenya. It lies between the towns of Lamu and Kiunga. This island is not very far from Lamu and is completely unaffected by tourism as people rarely visit it. One thing that deters travelers is the limited transport on the island. This island has some of the most impressive ruins and other places on the coast that are memorable. The water supply on this island is unpredictable and briny. Therefore, it is advisable for visitors to take water along. There are few small shops on the island which demands most islanders to live on home produced food and staples from Lamu. Mosquitoes and flies are a serious menace on Pete especially during rainy days. People carry mosquito repellents during the day. Which of the statements are true for Pate island?
The people of Pate Island get highly affected with mosquito related diseases. The water supply that is available on this island is very salty. The transport available on this island is limited. The Indian Space research organization announced in 2008 that it has conceptualized its first inter-planetary mission, which eventually got its funding from the Indian Government in 2012. Mangalyaan began orbiting Mars from September 24th 2014 and has since sent many valuable pieces of information including several pictures describing the planet’s mineralogy, morphology and topography. With this feat, ISRO has become the fourth space agency to enter Mars’ orbit after the Soviet Space program, NASA and European Space agency. Cryonics or cryopreservation is a medical procedure where humans or animals pronounced medically dead are preserved under extremely low temperatures with hope that in future, with progressive technology and medical advancements, their resuscitation will be possible. The concept came into existence in 1962 when Robert Ettinger suggested the preservation of humans in order to make the effects of clinical death reversible in the future. The idea was further supported by Evan Cooper who founded the Life Extension Society two years later to promote cryopreservation. The most popular case of cryonics is of baseball player Ted Williams, whose children decided to cryopreserve his remains. Other notable people include James Bedford, Thomas K. Donaldson and John-Henry Williams. So far, more than 270 people have undergone cryopreservation. What does the concept of Cryonics entail?

The squirrels are furry- tailed animals with large black eyes and rounded ears. The word squirrel comes from the Greek word skia, which means ‘shadow’ and oura, which means ‘tail’. Thus, the term means shadow-tailed and best describes squirrels as they use their tail to shade their whole body. These squirrels communicate with each other through scent marking and vocalisation. There are over 265 species of squirrel worldwide. The smallest squirrel is around 10 cm long whereas the largest is a massive 3 feet long. When this animal feels that it is in danger, it either remains motionless or runs to a nearby tree and climb to safety. Squirrels are one of the very few wild animals which eat out of a person’s hand. They are a symbol for preparation, thriftiness and trust. These are considered intelligent creatures which plan ahead in order to survive the challenging winter months in colder regions such as U.K. They store seeds and nuts at various locations and return to them throughout the colder months in order to maintain their energy levels when the food is scarce. Facts that are true for squirrels:

The word Switzerland originated from Schwyz, one of the three founder cantons. It is a federation of twenty six states that are also called cantons and four linguistic regions: German speaking, French speaking, Italian speaking and Roman speaking. This diversity raises the question of a national culture a recurring issue.{newline} Switzerland is a transition point between northern and southern Europe and between German and Latin cultures. It is characterized by The Jura mountains,densely urbanized plateau and the Alps range. Bern is the capital and is located in the center of the country.{newline} The population of Switzerland has increased more than fourfold since 1815, when the borders were established. Though the birthrate in this country has been decreasing since the end of the nineteenth century, immigration plays a vital role in increasing the population. Earlier there was a long tradition of emigration, but because of its rapid economic development, Switzerland became an immigration destination. Today it has one of the highest rates of foreigners in Europe.The people of Swiss are very religious. People rarely work on Sundays as they consider it a holy day. Most of the drugstores, supermarkets and banks are closed on Sunday.{newline} The Swiss people are formal people who never call their acquaintances by their first names. “Herr” and “Monsieur” are more frequently used to call or greet acquaintances. The Swiss people love punctuality and hence it is important to be on time to parties, business meetings and churches. That is why the tourists sometimes face problems as the trains never wait for late arrivers. In addition, we all know that Switzerland is a land of watches.

Hits like Papa don’t preach, Like a virgin and Into the Groove only consolidated her position at the top. Born on August 16, 1958 in Bay City, Michiganto Italian immigrants Joan and Tony Ciccone, Madonna moved to New York City in 1978 and found her way into the music industry as a backup singer to disco artist Patrick Hernandez. With over 300 million records sold worldwide, Madonna is listed by Guinness World Records as the best-selling female artist of all times. Known to many as the Queen of Pop, Madonna Louise Ciccone is a multi-Grammy award winning American singer and entertainer. She also tried her luck in the movie industry and fetched the title role of Argentinean Eva Peron in 1996 hit Evita. Her debut single, ‘Everyday’ released in 1982 to surprisingly positive response and paved way for the singer to reach the zenith.

When renowned Olympian and reality TV star Bruce Jenner (now Caitlyn Jenner) decided to come out as a pre-operative transgendered woman, a series of extreme reactions took the internet and media by storm. Jenner, parent to the popular Kardashian-Jenner siblings, was diagnosed with Gender Identity disorder, much earlier in life but kept her true identity a secret until 2015, when she declared her gender identity crisis during an interview with Diane Sawyer.{newline} Big names and organizations such as Barack Obama and ESPY’s applauded Jenner’s courage. In its June 2015 issue, Vanity Fair put Jenner on the cover and introduced Caitlyn Jenner to the world.{newline} Although Jenner completely identifies herself as a woman, she does not plan to undergo the sex reassignment surgery.{newline} Caitlyn Jenner’s story is a saga of grit, courage and willingness to live life on one’s own terms. She is a true inspiration to many young trans people across the world who are still dealing with issues such as bullying, acceptance and ostracism. What does Caitlyn Jenner identify herself as –

Civilization dawned when early man learnt how to produce heat energy by burning wood. Much later, the first industrial revolution was based on the production of steam by burning coal. Then steam was used (as it still is) to produce electricity. In this century, great use has been made of oil and natural gas, and in the last 25 years, the use of atomic reactors has provided another source of energy.{newline} But none of these fuels (except wood) is renewable. When they have been used, they cannot be replaced. Oil and natural gas may be finished by the year 2000; coal a century or two later and even atomic fuels are not inexhaustible. All of them, moreover, produce pollution of different kinds and amounts, and many people are concerned about the safety of the reactors. But solar energy- energy from the Sun- is non polluting and inexhaustible. What we have to do now is to find out how to make use of it. Choose the alternative which best summarises the topic of each paragraph:
Energy and civilization Sources of energy Historical development of energy sources Energy and history

The squirrels are furry- tailed animals with large black eyes and rounded ears. The word squirrel comes from the Greek word skia, which means ‘shadow’ and oura, which means ‘tail’. Thus, the term means shadow-tailed and best describes squirrels as they use their tail to shade their whole body. These squirrels communicate with each other through scent marking and vocalisation. There are over 265 species of squirrel worldwide. The smallest squirrel is around 10 cm long whereas the largest is a massive 3 feet long. When this animal feels that it is in danger, it either remains motionless or runs to a nearby tree and climb to safety. Squirrels are one of the very few wild animals which eat out of a person’s hand. Squirrels are also very trusting animals. Which of the statement is true for a squirrel?
